publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5264 Margaret Curran: 16 Days of Activism against Violence against Women—That the Parliament recognises that Wednesday 25 November 2009 will mark the beginning of the 16 days of Activism Against Violence Against Women; notes that the event runs from Wednesday 25 November until 10 December, International Human Rights Day; notes that this event is held over these dates to symbolically link violence against women with human rights and to underline that such violence is a direct violation of human rights; acknowledges that, since 1991, over 2,000 organisations in approximately 156 countries have participated in the 16 Days campaign, and calls on representatives, the local community and organisations across the country to continue to work together to raise awareness of violence against women as well as to tackle the underlying social, economic and cultural causes of gender-based violence.

S3M-5264 16 Days of Activism against Violence against Women (lodged on 23 November 2009) Brian Adam*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Johann Lamont*, Gil Paterson*, David Whitton*, George Foulkes*, Elaine Smith*, Ken Macintosh*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Patrick Harvie*, Bill Kidd*, Cathy Jamieson*, Helen Eadie*, Jackie Baillie*, Cathy Peattie*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Karen Whitefield*, Sandra White*, Pauline McNeill*, Trish Godman*, Rhona Brankin*, Patricia Ferguson*, Claire Baker*, Aileen Campbell*, Jack McConnell*, Jim Tolson*, Hugh Henry*, Bill Butler*

S3M-5264 Margaret Curran: 16 Days of Activism against Violence against Women—That the Parliament recognises that Wednesday 25 November 2009 will mark the beginning of the 16 days of Activism Against Violence Against Women; notes that the event runs from Wednesday 25 November until 10 December, International Human Rights Day; notes that this event is held over these dates to symbolically link violence against women with human rights and to underline that such violence is a direct violation of human rights; acknowledges that, since 1991, over 2,000 organisations in approximately 156 countries have participated in the 16 Days campaign, and calls on representatives, the local community and organisations across the country to continue to work together to raise awareness of violence against women as well as to tackle the underlying social, economic and cultural causes of gender-based violence. Supported by: Brian Adam, Malcolm Chisholm, Johann Lamont, Gil Paterson, David Whitton, George Foulkes, Elaine Smith, Ken Macintosh, Dr Richard Simpson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Patrick Harvie, Bill Kidd, Cathy Jamieson, Helen Eadie, Jackie Baillie, Cathy Peattie, Hugh O’Donnell, Karen Whitefield, Sandra White, Pauline McNeill, Trish Godman, Rhona Brankin, Patricia Ferguson, Claire Baker, Aileen Campbell, Jack McConnell, Jim Tolson, Hugh Henry, Bill Butler, Ross Finnie*, Marlyn Glen*, Cathie Craigie*, Stuart McMillan*, John Park*, Alison McInnes*
S3M-5264 16 Days of Activism against Violence against Women (lodged on 23 November 2009) Angela Constance*, Christina McKelvie*, Robert Brown*, Mary Mulligan*
